comment: He was very passionate about the class and helped motivate us to succeed. 85-100% was considered an A. Quizzes are 2 attempts and fairly simple. The study guides he posted were basically the exam itself. Attend lecture and hold yourself accountable outside of class!!

Hes a very nice person but this class needs more than a PowerPoint to stick. He is hard to access for office hours, he only offers one hour. He curves hard, but simply because his exams are harder and more descriptive than what he offers in his PowerPoints. He changed dates very last minute, and the final is cumulative. Good luck retaining info.

Powerpoints are vague in comparison to the test which go over the smallest details. Sidetracks a lot. Based only on assessments (3 tests, 12 quizzes, and final) and only two of the quizzes are dropped. The only highlight is the grading scale (100-85 is an A etc.). Always messes up grades and D2L. Avoid and take the other professor (Hessier).
